oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Schools; Rural schools; Public schools; Educational facilities
Education - Tennessee; Education - History - Tennessee; Rosenwald, Julius, 1862-1932; School buildings - Tennessee
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Side view of Bells Consolidated Rosenwald School in Crockett County. The prim-looking white schoolhouse has multiple windows and is set in a withered cornfield.

The Julius Rosenwald Fund was one of the private Northern philanthropic foundations that operated in Tennessee to aid the cause of black education. Crockett County received $5,200 in aid from the Fund for school construction by July 1, 1930. For Bells Consolidated School, Rosenwald contributed $900; public funds contributed $2,400; and black donors contributed $2,050.
